ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: unstable or contradication to treatment with antidepressants

Notes: 1=Proven non-responsive to other treatment option; 2=Patient symptoms consistent with treatment chosen; 3=Concerned about side effects of other choice; 4=Other, specify

ElementDescription: Does the patient have a family member, a spouse, or close friend who would be willing to take part in treatment?
ineligible for acute depression pharmacotherapy study
Has the patient been deemed fully eligible for the acute depression pharmacology study but has refused it
History of intolerance to more than one of the following: inositol, lamotrigine, or risperidone
Patient is in refractory depression pathway
My chances of receving a real medication to treat depression at this point are:
I believe the chances of my depression being completely better at the end of this study are:
Notes: 0= Very Poor; 1= Somewhat Poor; 2= Slightly Poor; 3= No Different; 4= Slightly Good; 5= Somewhat Good; 6= Very Good

ElementDescription: Compared with now, I think my depression at the end of this study will be:
Notes: 0= Much Worse; 1= Somewhat Worse; 2= Slightly Worse; 3= No Different; 4= Slightly Better; 5= Somewhat Better; 6= Much Better

ElementDescription: Was an major depressive episode present during the postpartum period?
Was an major depressive episode present during the antenatal period?
Does the patient have a history of a Major Depressive Disorder diagnosis recorded in the chart?
